comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Here we go: the "Procession" was reported in the SMH of 24/07/1925 p.13 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16233545 . Pages 12-14 are full of details of the visit, names, illustrations, etc. 'Arrangements' (which might not have actually happened) reported the week before - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16218225

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Trove is up again woohoo! Thanks for those links beachcomber, they are great articles.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
It struck me these guys are not the best marchers, and also the SMH correspondent. Amongst the pages of purple prose there is this gem -
" As to the marching, there is little doubt that British drill instructors would find it wanting in finish. But democracy does not take kindly to drill instructors. The British bluejacket marches with a pronounced roll, but though never as steady as the marines, he attains to a very fair degree of precision. The British marines, as those who have seen them will remember, march with machine-like steadiness. But in the United States navy not so much attention is given to the niceties of parade marching. The men covered the ground at a smart pace, and possibly that was all that was required of them. But the crowd cheered them warmly -- and plainly liked their looks. "
From - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1220140

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Good observation there! They certainly don't look completely uniform. An interesting article too, reveals something of the political leanings of the time.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 102613827@N03
comment._content: Gotta say that one of the most memorable moments of returning from Iraq in 2003 included pulling into Sydney Harbor and hearing the Australia Navy Band playing Waltzing Matilda.
